result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael L Heinowski

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant Michael L Heinowski appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz in court for Michael L Heinowski.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA TenHaken. Called @ 3:02 p.m. Matter before the court for waiver of preliminary hearing on 22CF480 and initial appearance on new file - 22CM526. Record by Atty. Lochowicz who is appointed on the felony file and asks to be appointed on the misdemeanor as well. Court orders him appointed on the CM file. Court goes over waiver form with the defendant as to the felony file. Court finds waiver to be knowing, voluntary, intelligent, and binds the defendant over for trial. Record by the State that the information will mirror the charges in the complaint. Response by Atty. Lochowicz who would like to proceed to arraignment today. Atty. enters not guilty pleas and demands a speedy trial at this time, but requests status before trial dates are set.  Atty. goes over charges/penalties as to new file and enters NG pleas in that file as well. 
Court addresses request to lift the no contact on file.  Record by Atty. Lochowicz that they would like contact allowed while the defendant is in the Walworth County Jail including phone and supervised visits. State objects to modification.
Victim is present in Court and responds to Court's questions. Victim is asking to have contact with the defendant and makes a record as to situation/reasons. Further record as to counseling and response to Court's questions. 
Court amends bond to allow contact while the defendant is in custody and sets matter for status as requested.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael L Heinowski in court, in custody via video.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. MFAC granted. Appointed with no repayment at this time. Defendant does not qualify for SPD at this time. Defendant is being held on P.O. hold and cash bond. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Michael L Heinowski in court, in custody by video.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant needs to talk to SPD. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDED 9/29/2022: DEFENDANT MAY HAVE CONTACT WITH VICTIM WHILE IN CUSTODY.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH D.L.H. dob 4-3-1959 or RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Michael L Heinowski in court, in custody by video. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Josh Ryan appeared for bond purposes only. Defendant referred to SPD. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Cash bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
